com.apigee.flow.message

Interface Message


  • public interface Message

    The Message class represents the message on the request or response flow. This class is protocol independent. To retrieve protocol-specific data associated with the message, use the getVariable(String s) method.

    Example: Set headers and content associated with the message. 

    public class JavaSimpleBlocking implements Execution {

    public ExecutionResult execute(MessageContext messageContext, ExecutionContext executionContext) {

        try {

            // Call methods on the Message object associated with the message context.
            messageContext.getMessage().setHeader("X-Header-Thread", Thread.currentThread().getName()); // executes in IO thread
            messageContext.getMessage().setHeader("X-Header_Foo", "Bar");
            messageContext.getMessage().setContent("Hello, World!");


            return ExecutionResult.SUCCESS;

        } catch (Exception e) {
            return ExecutionResult.ABORT;
        }
    }
}

    • Method Detail

      • getHeaderNames

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getHeaderNames()

      • getHeader

        java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String headerName)
        Gets the value of the specified header. Equivalent to getHeader(headerName, 1)
        Parameters:
        headerName - The name of the header to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The value associated with the header name. If the header has multiple values, this method retrieves the first one.

      • getHeader

        java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String headerName,
                           int index)
        Gets a particular value of a multivalued header.
        Parameters:
        headerName - The name of the multivalued header.
        index - The index of the value to get. Index starts at 1.
        Returns:
        The value of the multivalued header at the specified index number.

      • getHeaders

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getHeaders(java.lang.String headerName)
        Gets all the values of a multivalued header.
        Parameters:
        headerName - The name of the header to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The set of values associated with the header.

      • getHeadersAsString

        java.lang.String getHeadersAsString(java.lang.String headerName)
        Gets all the values of a multivalued header as string. The string is constructed using the transport specific separator.
        Parameters:
        headerName - The name of the multivalued header to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The set of values associated with the header.

      • getHeadersAsObject

        java.lang.Object getHeadersAsObject(java.lang.String headerName)
        Parameters:
        headerName - The name of the multivalued header to retrieve.
        Returns:
        An object representation of the header values.

      • setHeader

        boolean setHeader(java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.Object value)
        Sets the value of a header. Any existing values will be removed.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the header to set.
        value - The header value to set.
        Returns:
        true if the header was set successfully.

      • setHeader

        boolean setHeader(java.lang.String name,
                  int index,
                  java.lang.Object value)
        Sets a particular value of a multivalued header
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the header to set.
        index - The index of the value to be set. The exisiting value at that index will be overwritten.
        value - The header value to set.
        Returns:
        true if the header was set successfully.

      • removeHeader

        boolean removeHeader(java.lang.String headerName)
        Removes the specified header.
        Parameters:
        headerName - The name of the header to remove from the message.
        Returns:
        true if the header was removed; false if the header did not exist.

      • removeHeader

        boolean removeHeader(java.lang.String headerName,
                     int index)
        Removes a particular value of a multi-valued header.
        Parameters:
        headerName - The name of the header to remove from.
        index - The index of the value to remove (starts with 1)
        Returns:
        true if the header value was removed successfully; false otherwise.

      • getContent

        java.lang.String getContent()

        Gets the message content.

        Note: Avoid using this method with large payloads because the entire payload of the message is loaded into memory.

        Returns:
        The entire content of the message as string.

      • getContentAsStream

        java.io.InputStream getContentAsStream()

      • setContent

        void setContent(java.io.InputStream inStream)
        Sets the entire content of the message. The entire InputStream will be read immediately until EOF and stored in a buffer. For that reason, avoid using this method to stream a large message body.
        Parameters:
        inStream - The input stream to read.

      • setContent

        void setContent(java.lang.String content)
        Set the entire content of the message by converting the specified string using the character set that has already been set on the message using Content-Type, or UTF-8 by default.
        Parameters:
        content - The content to set.

      • setAsyncContent

        AsyncContent setAsyncContent(ExecutionContext ectx,
                             MessageContext mctx)
        Return an object that the user can use to asynchronously push content that will be streamed to the other side if streaming mode is enabled. The entire message body need not be kept in memory at once in this mode.
        Parameters:
        ectx - the current ExecutionContext, so that we can schedule the asynchronous work
        mctx - the MessageContext associated with this message

      • prepareForResponseFlow

        void prepareForResponseFlow()
        Prepares the message for the response flow.

        Retrieves a specific variable associated with the message.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the property
        Returns:
        The value associated with the property

                    java.lang.Object value)
        Sets the value of a variable associated with the message.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the property
        value - The value associated with the property
        Returns:
        true if the value was set; false if the value could not be updated.

      • removeVariable

        Removes the value of a variable associated with the message.
        Parameters:
        name - T he name of the variable to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the variable existed and was removed; false otherwise.

        int getQueryParamsCount()
        Gets the number of query parameters if the message is a request.
        Returns:
        The number of query parameters.

      • getQueryParam

        java.lang.String getQueryParam(java.lang.String queryParamName)
        Gets the query parameter value. Equivalent to getQueryParam(queryParamName, 1)
        Parameters:
        queryParamName - The name of the query param to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The value associated with the query param name. Returns the first value in case the query parameter has multiple values associated with it.

      • getQueryParamValuesCount

        int getQueryParamValuesCount(java.lang.String queryParamName)
        Gets the number of values that the specified query param has.
        Parameters:
        queryParamName - The query parameter name.
        Returns:
        The number of values for the query parameter.

      • getQueryParam

                               int index)
        Gets a particular value of a multivalued query parameter.
        Parameters:
        queryParamName - The name of the multivalued query parameter.
        index - The index of the value to get. Index starts with 1.
        Returns:
        The value of the multivalued query parameter at the specified index.

        Parameters:
        queryParamName - The name of the query param to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The set of values associated with the query parameter.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The set of values associated with the query parameter.
